pros: • The position allows for exploration into many different technologies: 3D printing, CNC woodworking, laser engraving, etc. • The head coordinator of the space is incredibly kind and accommodating, always made sure to properly listen to feedback about what could be improved within the work space, always cared about making sure everyone was satisfied with work conditions, truly made working there as fluid and fun as possible while ensuring clients coming into the space were provided with the support and resources they needed • Encouraging of creative endeavors and allowing for additional workshops and events to be run multiple times throughout the year. Any ideas for such workshops will normally be allowed so long as a few basic criteria are met • Easy to trade shifts or reorganize schedules with other staff members • All around positive environment to work in with potential for advancement to be a tool team leader or overall team leader
cons: • Can sometimes be a larger time commitment during busier times of year, but can be talked through if scheduling conflicts cannot be avoided • Can be intimidating/difficult to learn all of the available technologies the job requires, takes a bit of time to adapt but leaves you feeling confident in your ability to learn after getting it

review_title: Awesome potential and some amazing people but the presented picture is often not reality
job_title: Associate Director of Residence Life in Elon, NC
pros:
-People are hardworking and high achieving similar to it's student base
-You can make immediate and positive impacts from day one in your role
-Flexible schedule for most part of the year (supervisor dictate this differently)
-Opportunities abound for growth in other areas of professional/personal interest 
-Collaborative environment lends very well to growing your network if you know how to play the political game
-Professional development focus, funding and opportunities are leaps and bounds beyond most schools Elon's size or type. This is a cultural facet from the top down that is hard to replicate or find at most schools let alone small private ones. 
-All levels repeatedly state and voice a conscious effort at doing and supporting anti-racist work and increasing DEI knowledge/skills of staff/fac/students but the delivery doesn't match the volume of what is projected as reality.
cons:
-Salary is too low for the overworking they will do of you
-"Elon runs lean" is shared by senior admins like its a slogan of pride when it should be one of shame. The lean nature of staff leads to burnout frequently of talented and exceptional folks who could have benefitted the institution long term if the institution took care of properly investing in it's folks the same way the invest in it and through their work.
-Many of Elon's professional practices (Striving for perfection; "The Elon way"; micromanagement; hierarchical structures; etc.) are steeped in white supremacist culture
-All levels of admin. repeatedly state and voice a conscious effort at doing and supporting anti-racist work and increasing DEI knowledge/skills of staff/fac/students but the delivery doesn't match the volume of what is projected as reality.
-Supervisory structures are riddled (not entirely) with folks who have mentality of "I suffered though and paid my dues to get to where I am so everyone else needs to do the same" which is a toxic mindset to have as a supervisor.

pros: Elon has a great culture buy-in from it's employees and students. Dr. Book, like Dr. Lambert, is a transformational leader who will continue to take Elon to the top as an institution with a national reputation.
cons: Elon has, and will continue, to hemorrhage employee talent due to inflexible work modalities. Employees are expected to be on-campus working throughout the week without exception, and there is currently zero discussion happening campus-wide about a policy change.

review_title: Excellent university with great support for faculty
pros: This is a friendly community of teacher/scholar/mentors and a great place for staff and faculty in regard to the work atmosphere, perks and positive attitudes of supervisors and administrators at all levels. Definitely a wonderful place to work. Beautiful campus, well-appointed office spaces, attention to employee needs in regard to providing the training and equipment to succeed is outstanding. Great location within an hour's drive of Raleigh, Durham, Chapel Hill, Greensboro, High Point and Winston-Salem and six hours or less from Washington, DC, Charleston and Atlanta. Three-hour drive to the Outer Banks on the Atlantic and a three-hour drive to the NC mountains of the Appalachian Trail and the Blue Ridge Parkway.
cons: If you want to live in an overpopulated urban area, Elon is not it. It is located a short drive from urban attractions in a cluster of idyllic small towns in Alamance County. All of the shopping and dining choices found in a typical suburb can be found here - Target, Home Depot, Bed-Bath-Beyond, Kohls, Best Buy, Michael's, Red Lobster, Chili's, Texas Roadhouse, Olive Garden and dozens more - but there are not many non-chain restaurants, no local opera company, no pro sports right here, locally.

pros: Working for Elon, you truly feel a strong sense of community across campus. Expect to work with other departments on a regular basis, so this helps a lot. The university is almost obsessed with doing things perfectly, but this means your job is valued, and the people you are surrounded by truly, genuinely care about their day-to-day work.
cons: Not the best location for a young, single person (but nearby Greensboro & Durham/Chapel Hill are great). Largest concern is the presence of those who "drank the kool aid", and live and breath the university. These are the individuals around you who won't understand a true work/life balance. There are not always concrete actions to be seen for this, but more so the social climate for staff members on campus. This is certainly not every area on campus, but something to be aware of. Other than this, don't expect a great HR/development presence on campus. Each office/department is overly compartmentalized, so employee development can be lacking in some offices.

review_title: Great work environment and young staff.  Great opportunities for professional development.
job_title: Assistant Director Recreation in Elon, NC
pros: Great place to work for younger staff.  Many entry level positions for those looking to work in higher education.  Good benefits.  Beautiful campus.  Amazing opportunities for staff to be advisors for trips, groups, etc regardless if you are a professor, student life staff member, even administrative assistants!
cons: Low salary compared to other universities.  University as a whole treats their students like children - almost like an extended high school.  Be prepared to interact with parents more so than your average university.  Most positions are revolving doors - many people do not stay for more than 2-3 years because of low salary (not because of job atmosphere).

pros: Elon offers strong retirement and health benefits. Advancement opportunities exist for those who engage in achieving strategic goals.  A great opportunity to work with a community of talented and highly engaged professionals who work endlessly to help others achieve their academic and professional goals. The campus is beautiful. The students are extraordinary.
cons: Elon has less than 2,000 employees. A low percentage of workforce turnover makes moving into higher level positions difficult.

pros: This is a small private university that is growing and expanding.  The major areas it is know for are Communications, Physical Therapy and Liberal Arts.  The work environment is friendly, not alot of micro-management.  If you get your work done, everybody get's along.
cons: It's in a small town outside Greensboro, NC, so some of the salaries may not be as competitive as other major metropolitan cities.  You will have to drive a little ways for more adventurous night life and other events.

job_title: Resources & Communications Coordinator in Elon College, NC
pros: Collaborative culture of engaged learning. Driven to provide premier professional development opportunities for all its constituents. Employees are acknowledged for their work and supported by the administration to achieve professional development goals.
cons: Although the campus has grown over the years, it seems that the number of staff working to manage the added facilities has not grown at the same rate. For example, repairs to facilities used to take less than 24 hours to occur, now take sometimes three times longer to be addressed or resolved.

review_title: My experience was varied, ranging from feeling very stimulated to totally overburdened with work tasks.
pros: The university has a beautiful campus, there are many great colleagues, and the infra-structure in terms of computers, facilities, etc., is really good.
cons: Elon University pays very low salaries, it demands too much of its faculty, and it asks employees to contribute $ to the university (!).  It has a nontransparent process for promotion and tenure.

pros: Elon is very supportive of their employees and the company culture is that it is the Elon family.  As a result, it is a great place to work in order to have work/life balance.  Most jobs have a lot of variety to them and keeps things interesting.
cons: While the salaries are fair, it is an educational institution.  As a result, they will usually be less than those in corporate sectors.  However, the benefits package is wonderful and does a lot to compensate for slightly lower salaries.

review_title: Overall positive place to work with many perks instead of wages.
pros: Tuition Remission for staff, spouse and children.  Beautiful outdoor environment. opportunities for some professional development and education. Great fitness center at no cost.
cons: Distinct social and professional hierarchy of people based on division between Physical Plant, Hourly, Salary, Faculty and Administrative Staff. The leaders are almost all white men in suits.

pros: Great culture, excellent staff support, they work extremely well with your class schedule. Pay was above minimum wage, which was great. Good opportunity to interact with professionals in the academic realm.
cons: The office that I worked in was a popular spot for many students, however, there was not a clear division between work space and social gathering.

review_title: Student at Elon University majoring in Finance while minoring in Entrepreneurship and Leadership.
pros: Amazing opportunities for students who are ambitious and have a go-getter mentality.
cons: Their seems to be a upper middle class white privilege culture at times; however, if you truly care to find racial as well as socio-economic diversity it is definitely here and growing!

pros: Elon has a great energy. Kind students that are above average. The town and surrounding area of Burlington is OK, but not an easy place to live if you're single. Elon also caters to married/partnered faculty and staff. Young unmarrieds are at a disadvantage when it comes to study abroad and tickets to stuff.
cons: Elon has its share of  bureaucracy, but what university doesn't. There's a lot of top down decisions, but the president is a good guy.

pros: Everything is very collaborative. Age and hierarchy do not mean too much here. I loved my role and even though I was lower than most, I didn't feel that way. People trusted me and my opinions.
cons: You definitely need to get used to the culture of the university. It is mainly wealthy students from the Northeast with very minimal diversity. Takes some getting used to.

pros:
1. Work closely and develop good relationships with people in higher ed positions.

2.Encouraged to study or work on school work during down time.

3. Base pay $9.00

4.Minimal manual labor.

5. Weekends Off.
cons: At times it can be boring, especially if you complete all of your tasks early. Lunch time is too short!

pros: Good salary for those without an advanced degree. Good work culture in every department. Elon University is constantly growing and will only continue to be nationally recognized as one of the best universities in the nation.
cons: Long hours, always plenty (sometimes too much) work but Elon will not add additional employees. Has a competitive/pressurized feel to it.

pros: plenty of growth opportunities; collegial; good benefits; caring administrators
cons: culture of busyness; lack of diversity in student, faculty and staff
